Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChordMessageInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class Chord
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ChordMessageInterface
    Version:
    1.0 build 1 Nov 3, 2015 The class for the chord potion of a node Preforms the joining to other nodes and transfering of data
    Author:
    Joe McCully
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • in

        public java.lang.Boolean in(int key,
                   int key1,
                   int key2)
        Description of in(int key, int key1, int key2) Check if key is in the semi-open interval (key1, key2] Since it is a ring, key1 can be greater than key2. In that case we verify whether key > key2 or key <= key1

      • ino

        public java.lang.Boolean ino(int key,
                    int key1,
                    int key2)
        Description of ino(int key, int key1, int key2) Check if key is in the open interval (key1, key2) Since it is a ring, key1 can be greater than key2. In that case we verify whether key > key2 or key < key1

      • stabilize

        public void stabilize()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      java.net.UnknownHostException
        Description of stabilize() fixes the nodes after a new node joins i.e. changes the successor and predecessor so all the nodes form a ring
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.net.UnknownHostException
